title: Validate DLP/DRM is able to detect the label and applies the policy with Alert Action for Email with Encrypted Sensitivity Label coming from SMTP Proxy with Flexible Email Scan Feature on Email body
custom_preconds:
"- MIP feature should be enabled
- Enable Flexible Email Scan Feature
- Setup Microsot Instance under ""Settings --> Sensitivity Label Integration""
- Create a filter filter profile with Sensitivity label -> select microsoft instance -> check ""Detect object with classification label applied from the selected instance"" and select desired labels
- Create a DLP rule and select all required files, and Content secion, make sure the ""Body"" is checked. 
- Create a DLP profile with created DLP rule.
- Setup Exchange Domain in SMTP Under Settings -> Security Cloud Platform -> SMTP -> add Exchange account"
custom_steps:
"- Create a Email Outbound Policy for Exchange Domain with Alert action + DLP Profile that was created in pre-condtions.
- Draft a email in Outlookg with subject+body+attachment, where body matches to the DLP profile
- Assign any Encrypted Sensitivity Lable to the mail, that matched to the file filter.
- Send the email to another outlook account.
"
custom_expected:
"- SMTP proxy should receive it and send for DLP for inspection.
- DLP should then send it to DRM for parsing and it should read the label and let DLP know about the label info
- DLP Alert event should be generated and should be visible in skope-it events.
- SMTP proxy should forward to traffic to receipient
- Receipent should receive the email and content shouldn't be tampered.
- Validate the contents of email
- No sevice crashes should be observed."
